de.tif.jacob.screen.event
Class IBrowserEventHandler

java.lang.Object
  de.tif.jacob.event.EventHandler
      de.tif.jacob.screen.event.GuiEventHandler
          de.tif.jacob.screen.event.IBrowserEventHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
IInformBrowserEventHandler
public abstract class IBrowserEventHandler
extends GuiEventHandler

Abstract event handler class for browsers. Derived implementations of this event handler class have to be used to "hook" application-specific business logic to browsers.

Method Detail

decorateCell

public Icon decorateCell(IClientContext context,
                         IBrowser browser,
                         int row,
                         int column,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. use decorateCell(IClientContext, IBrowser, int, int, IDataBrowserRecord, String) instead

Decorate the cell for the given browser with an predefined icon. A browser can be an in-form browser or a search browser.

Note: To access the data browser record for a given row index use IBrowser.getDataRecord(int) since otherwise the current user sort order might not be considered!

Parameters:
context - the current client context
browser - the browser itself
row - the row which can be filtered
column - the column
value - the original value from the database
Returns:
The Icon type or Icon.NONE. Note: null is not a valid value.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7
See Also:
IBrowser.getDataRecord(int)

decorateCell

                         IBrowser browser,
                         int row,
                         int column,
                         IDataBrowserRecord record,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Decorate the cell for the given browser with an predefined icon. A browser can be an in-form browser or a search browser.

Parameters:
context - the current client context
browser - the browser itself
row - the row which can be filtered
column - the column
record - the data browser record of this row
value - the original value from the database
Returns:
The Icon type or Icon.NONE. Note: null is not a valid value.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7.2

filterCell

public java.lang.String filterCell(IClientContext context,
                                   IBrowser browser,
                                   int row,
                                   int column,
                                   java.lang.String value)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. use filterCell(IClientContext, IBrowser, int, int, IDataBrowserRecord, String) instead

Filters the cell data for the given browser. A browser can be an in-form browser or a search browser.

Note: To access the data browser record for a given row index use IBrowser.getDataRecord(int) since otherwise the current user sort order might not be considered!

Parameters:
context - the current client context
browser - the browser itself
row - the row which can be filtered
column - the column
value - the original value from the database
Returns:
the new value for the browser or null to keep cell empty.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
IBrowser.getDataRecord(int)

browser - the browser itself
row - the row which can be filtered
column - the column
record - the data browser record of this row

hasChildren

public boolean hasChildren(IClientContext context,
                           IBrowser browser,
                           IDataBrowserRecord record)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Returns whether the given record has children.
Intended as an optimization for when the viewer does not need the actual children. Clients may be able to implement this more efficiently than getChildren.

Parameters:
context -
browser -
record -
Returns:
whether the given record has children
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7.4
See Also:

                                  IBrowser browser,

                                    IBrowser browser,
                                    IDataTableRecord selectedRecord)

This hook method will be called, if the user selects a record in the browser.

Parameters:
context - the current client context
browser - The browser with the click event
selectedRecord - the record which has been selected
Throws:

onDataChanged

public void onDataChanged(IClientContext context,
                          IBrowser browser,
                          IDataBrowser data)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
The data of the browser has been changed.
You can override this method to preprocess the data and set error/warning decorations.

Parameters:
context - the current client context
browser - The browser with the click event
data - The new data of the browser.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
IBrowser.setErrorDecoration(IClientContext, de.tif.jacob.core.data.IDataRecord, String), IBrowser.setWarningDecoration(IClientContext, de.tif.jacob.core.data.IDataRecord, String)

beforeAction

public boolean beforeAction(IClientContext context,
                            IBrowser browser,
                            IDataBrowserRecord record)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
This event method will be called, if the user clicks on a row in the corresponding browser. You can prevent the selection/backfill of the IDataBrowserRecord if you return false. Nevertheless, you should inform the user by means of a proper notification, e.g. create and show a message dialog.

Parameters:
context - The current context of the application
browser - The browser (the emitter of the event)
record - The corresponding record
Returns:
Return false, if you want to avoid the execution of the action else return true.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Since:
2.7.4
